details.publicNotes:
A skreel is a strange and highly prized creature in Everglow. They resemble large mouthed eels, but they have the strange ability to swim through the air. Likewise, when they dive under the waves, the water around them can function as if it were air, allowing both land creatures and aquatic creatures to breathe.  Their bodies are between 10 and 15 feet long with a deep green and brown hue to blend in with woods and muds, its two preferred environments. Skreels have a deep bulging neck pouch which it uses to generate and circulate the water in the bubble of water that it carries with it. Spines along its back and jaws create a pulse of electricity to hunt prey. Its long flexible tail can flick through the water like a whip to disorient targets before snapping them up in their jaws. Not only do they swim, but the air in which they pass behaves as if it were water, while still allowing creatures to breathe. This strange dual nature that surrounds them makes them ideal traveling companions for Shimmershells and other aquatic races that seek adventure on dry land, but also for Ponies and land folk that wish to explore under the waves. The secret to this is a magical organ that the Skreel carries in its chest, similar to an air bladder. How this works in the details isn’t yet known, but the effects have been measured and observed.

 

A young skreel is usually between 1 and 2 feet long, and is relatively tame and trainable. If kept on a steady diet, they can remain this size, like a goldfish staying small in a small bowl.

actions.label: Jaws
actions.description: If the target is wearing mostly metal armor, it deals an additional 2d6 lightning damage.

If the target is wearing mostly metal armor, it deals an additional 2d6 lightning damage.

actions.label: tail
actions.description: The target must make a DC 23 Fortitude Saving Throw or be Slowed 1, Slowed 2 on a Critical Failure, until the end of their next turn.

description.value: The target must make a DC 23 Fortitude Saving Throw or be Slowed 1, Slowed 2 on a Critical Failure, until the end of their next turn.
The target must make a DC 23 Fortitude Saving Throw or be Slowed 1, Slowed 2 on a Critical Failure, until the end of their next turn.

The Skreel has a strange ability to alter reality, changing water and air into a strange hybrid of both. All air or water within 30 feet of the Skreel functions as both air and water. Aquatic creatures can swim and survive in this bubble as if it were water. Land and flying creatures can breathe or fly as if it were air. However, this functions as difficult terrain for creatures that are not swimming. If a creature is at the edge of the bubble when the Skreel moves, they can choose to be left behind, falling if airborne, or to be pulled along with the bubble as it moves. Unattended objects float or sink as if they were in water, but are otherwise unaffected. This does not quench or extinguish fires.

Trigger: If the Skreel takes damage from a melee attack.
Effect: The skreel deals 5d6 lightning damage (Basic Fortitude Saving Throw DC 23) to all creatures within 5 feet.
A creature wearing primarily metal armor decreases the result of their saving throw by one level.
If the target is wearing mostly metal armor, it deals an additional 2d6 lightning damage.
The target must make a DC 23 Fortitude Saving Throw or be Slowed 1, Slowed 2 on a Critical Failure, until the end of their next turn.

Skreel can whirl the bubble in a quick circle, disorienting those within it before striking. The skreel can move up to three creatures within its Reality Bubble up to 15 feet in any direction. All creatures must make a DC 23 Fortitude Saving Throw.
Critical Success: The creature is unaffected
Success: The creature is moved up to 15 feet in any direction of the Skreel's choice.
Failure:  As success but the Skreel may also use a Jaws or Tail attack against the target.
Critical Failure: As failure but the Skreel may also use a Jaws and Tail attack against the target.

Each of these attacks count towards the Skree's  multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until the Skreel has made all the attacks. Once this is used, it cannot be used again until the Skreel gets a Critical Success with a Jaws or Tail attack.
